thread.title: Seeing double: Norwich twins take up the same career as train conductors
thread.title_full: Seeing double: Norwich twins take up the same career as train conductors | Anglia - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: Seeing double: Norwich twins take up the same career as train conductors
text:
If you're travelling on Abellio Greater Anglia trains, you could be forgiven for thinking you're seeing double.
24-year-old twins, Adam and Luke Putland from Norwich , are both conductors for the company and are used to passengers looking a little confused.
Luke (left) and Adam (right). Credit: ITV News Anglia Luke (on the left) is the younger of the twins (by two minutes) but he is a senior conductor, while Adam has only just qualified.
He used to work in the buffet car.
"People do a double take and say 'didn't you just check my ticket?'
I have to say that I don't know what they're talking about."
– Adam Putland The twins say that they have similar interests. Credit: ITV News Anglia Now that they're both conductors they rarely work the same shifts together.
The boys have many shared interest - trains and animals among them. But insist they also try to be independent.
The twins rarely work the same shifts together. Credit: ITV News Anglia "We try and lead as separate lives as possible.
We try and get a few interests by ourselves and sometimes do stuff by ourselves.
But when you live together and you've had a twin all your life, of course you're going to pick up the same interests. I don't know any different from not having a twin"
– Adam Putland So if you're travelling by train it's not just on tickets you can get a two for one deal.
Click below to watch a report from ITV News Anglia's Victoria Marshall
